meanings.definition: A warning or call to arms
meanings.sent1: The alarum rang out, signaling danger ahead.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers quickly responded to the alarum, ready for battle.
meanings.sent3: When the alarum sounded, everyone knew it was time to prepare for action.
meanings.sent4: The alarum echoed through the valley, stirring the troops to action.
meanings.sent5: The piercing sound of the alarum made everyone stop in their tracks.

meanings.sent1: The sudden alarum startled the birds from their perches.
meanings.sent2: The alarum of the fire alarm filled the building with noise.
meanings.sent3: The alarum of the car horn made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The alarum of the thunderstorm kept the children awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The alarum of the barking dog alerted the neighbors to trouble.

meanings.definition: To sound an alarm or warning signal
meanings.sent1: He will alarum the town if there is any danger approaching.
meanings.sent2: The security guard will alarum the building in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent3: Don't alarum the cat, or it will run away in fear.
meanings.sent4: The loudspeaker will alarum the students to evacuate the building.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock will alarum you awake in the morning.
